body:
I do not want us to maintain our own lambda docs.

Amazon needs to provide useful docs that solve their users problems, and then I'm happy for us to have an FAQ that links to it.
@davdunc David, could you forward this FAQ to the docs team at AWS? Thanks!

issue.title: Error while loading in cryptography version 35.0.0

repository.name: cryptography
repository.description: cryptography is a package designed to expose cryptographic primitives and recipes to Python developers.

issue.body:
```
from .api_jwk import PyJWK, PyJWKSet
File "/tmp/project/jwt/api_jwk.py", line 3, in 
from .algorithms import get_default_algorithms
File "/tmp/project/jwt/algorithms.py", line 6, in 
from .utils import (
File "/tmp/project/jwt/utils.py", line 6, in 
from cryptography.hazmat.primitives.asymmetric.ec import EllipticCurve
File "/tmp/project/cryptography/hazmat/primitives/asymmetric/ec.py", line 15, in 
from cryptography.hazmat.primitives.asymmetric import (
File "/tmp/project/cryptography/hazmat/primitives/asymmetric/utils.py", line 6, in 
from cryptography.hazmat.bindings._rust import asn1
ImportError: /tmp/project/cryptography/hazmat/bindings/_rust.abi3.so: invalid ELF header
```

It works fine in version 3.4.7

issue.title: AWS lambda: version `GLIBC_2.18' not found (required by /var/task/cryptography/hazmat/bindings/_rust.abi3.so)

repository.name: cryptography
repository.description: cryptography is a package designed to expose cryptographic primitives and recipes to Python developers.

issue.body:
Hello,
We are facing the following error on aws lambda python3.7 runtime:
```
[ERROR] Runtime.ImportModuleError: Unable to import module 'main': /lib64/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.18' not found (required by /var/task/cryptography/hazmat/bindings/_rust.abi3.so)
Traceback (most recent call last):
```
by default our pip install uses the `cryptography-35.0.0-cp36-abi3-manylinux_2_17_x86_64.manylinux2014_x86_64.whl` package.
I also tried the `cryptography-35.0.0-cp36-abi3-manylinux_2_24_x86_64.whl` pkg without success.
 
currently the workaround is to use an older release (cryptography==3.4.8)
thank you a lot for your help

body:
Just to mention the error message from AWS Lambda function, to help people to see this page faster (because it took me hours to find solutions).

```
[ERROR] Runtime.ImportModuleError: Unable to import module 'main': /lib64/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.18' not found (required by /var/task/cryptography/hazmat/bindings/_rust.abi3.so)
Traceback (most recent call last):
```

For people using pipenv, you might need to use this method (in top post) to replace what pipenv installed.
I failed to find a way to do the same thing in pipenv.

for pipenv
```bash
pipenv run pip install \                                                                                             
    --platform manylinux2010_x86_64 \
    --target=$(pipenv --venv)/lib/python3.9/site-packages \
    --implementation cp \
    --python 3.9 \
    --only-binary=:all: --upgrade \
    cryptography
```

repository.name: cryptography
repository.description: cryptography is a package designed to expose cryptographic primitives and recipes to Python developers.

body: A note for people finding this after cryptography 38.0.0 is released: We no longer ship manylinux2010 wheels. You will instead need to target `manylinux2014` or `manylinux_2_17` at minimum (the latter is an alias for the former).
